Oct. 1, 2009 - David Letterman told the audience of his late night talk show that he had sexual relationships with female members of his staff, adding that he'd forked over a bogus $2 million check as part of an extortion plot on the matter. 
 
 Letterman, 62, made the confessions to the audience during a taping of "The Late Show" for broadcast Thursday night, according to a statement by Worldwide Pants Inc., Letterman's production company. 
 
 David Letterman Extortion Plot, Admits Sexual Affairs With Staffers - ABC News
 
 By the way, Letterman is married to Regina Lasko, who previous to their marriage was his long-time girlfriend.

 No, J.P. I have never driven a 1200HP car. I have no need to compensate for anything.
 
 I am a Volvo driver, in our household we have 4 Volvos, 2 old 240's one S70, and a 940 station wagon.
 
 The last car I bought, and probably my final, and that my son drives to work daily, is a Mercedes C180, kompressor. I bought it several years ago almost new, it was in pristine condition (the proverbial old lady's car) because it is economical, it has rear wheel drive, a superb suspension, front and rear, handles like a dream and has enough power to navigate the cut and throat traffic of Sydney. Of course it has superb quality and engineering, although being German it has some quirks and teutonic peculiarities.
 
 I bought it not to show off ( I didn't build it) but only because Volvo abandoned rear wheel drive many years ago.
 
 A big penis and big balls do not make a man J.P.
 
 1200 hp of compensation means that you have something very tiny between your legs to require such a massive compensation.

 My question...who really cares?
 
 I must say, I admire his honesty. If only our elected officials could learn a little something from him. Personally, I never really got into Letterman, I was always more of a Leno fan myself. But people sit here talking about morality and sin as if Letterman has somehow let them down personally? Get a life people. If you are looking to Letterman for an example of morality, you probably don't know the meaning of the word. 
 
 I could care absolutely less who Letterman is getting his winkie wet with...it just really doesn't matter to me. I higly doubt people watch his show because they think he is a font of morality.
